block.p: Carina Louise Yervasi, an assistant professor of French, and Leopold Joseph Charney, a Web site editor, were married yesterday at the King County Courthouse in Seattle. Judge Eileen A. Kato of the King County District Court officiated.

Ms. Yervasi, 35, will keep her name. She teaches at the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor. She graduated cum laude from Hofstra University and received master's and doctoral degrees in French from the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.

Carina Louise Yervasi, an assistant professor of French, and Leopold Joseph Charney, a Web site editor, were married yesterday at the King County Courthouse in Seattle. Judge Eileen A. Kato of the King County District Court officiated.

Ms. Yervasi, 35, will keep her name. She teaches at the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor. She graduated cum laude from Hofstra University and received master's and doctoral degrees in French from the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.

She is a daughter of Eva and Rocco Yervasi of Webster, N.Y. The bride's father retired as the marketing communications manager for the print and publishing division of the Eastman Kodak Company in Rochester. Her mother retired as the president of Imageering of Rochester, marketing-communications consultants, and she was a lecturer on management communications at the Simon Graduate School of Business at the University of Rochester.

Mr. Charney, 36, is the senior editor of the Web site Movies.com, a Walt Disney Company subsidiary based in Seattle. He graduated magna cum laude from Yale University and received master's and doctoral degrees in cinema studies from New York University.

He is a son of Hana and Maurice Charney of New York. His mother is a professor of French and comparative literature at Hunter College and the CUNY Graduate Center. His father is a distinguished professor of English at Rutgers in New Brunswick, N.J.
